item.title: Chunks missing from around manhole cover, wheelchair got stuck, 26th October
item.description:
My wheelchair front wheel got stuck in one ofbthe missing chunks. The force caused my chair to spin about 45 degrees. Would be very dangerous at night due to limited lighting so it would be impossible to view.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 13, Ancaster Road, Elmers End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very dangerous lethally bad crossing point, 26th October
item.description:
At junction of Baron street and White Lion street on the Angel side There is what i would term a blind, counter-intuitive crossing where traffic has to drive on the right hand side and makes a sweeping right-hander across the face of the junction It is potentially lethal for pedestrians as the visbility across the roadway is impaired and also the pedestrian has to look 180 degrees over their left shoulder at vehicles coming from Baron street crossing into White Lion street This junction is suicidally bad and someone will be knocked down and killed soon I had 3 vehicles turn at speed across my line of vision the last was a motorcyclist with two riders in black so only my Dad told me about defensive driving, I could be dead now I hope you do something about this - ramps, road markings or else re-route the junction and change the flow There is no sense in encouraging right sided driving in this country it is totally daft I will be writing to the council and my local MP also on this matter Yours faithfully Kevin Newman
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12-20, Baron Street, Barnsbury, London
Report on FixMyStreet
